column4: Anyone know if there's a good version of Ubuntu to put on PS3? yellowdog just doesn't cut it.
I'd love to install it, but need that little (switch to PS3 game OS) widget.
Jason: terrible, don't do it.
I mean, the thing basically runs on it to begin with, but trying any normal desktop ui on it ends in massive fail.
PSP linux?
That's not OT
hsystem: Wha?
Yeah, I've got Yellowdog, but...
Well, it sucks horribly.
Hence being in #Ubuntu
you dont have to, at the boot prompt type "boot-game-os"
or maybe boot_game_os, i cant remember
you normally get a prompt where you just hit enter to boot, right? its been a while since i used ps3 linux, they may have changed things on me since.
to boot, you need logpass.
You must enter your logpass, but that is not the issue; I need to find an easy way to return the system default boot mode.

when i did it, it start something called loadlin, which was just a small linux that booted the new linux kernel off the hard drive, if you typed "boot_game_os" instead of hitting enter, it would boot into the game os.
ohh, that part of boot.
lol
yeah, i never had to reset anything.
I guess I just need to figure out syntax.
actually, I'll try that right now.
